Accuracy for 1k: 0.3021
Accuracy for full dataset: 0.3018
Chosen feature intersection: {80, 45, 86, 111}
Top-5 at higher: {101, 45, 111, 80, 86}

QUESTIONS:
a) Feature Intersections:
    80: index 80 maps to feature 50 which is liwc_death
        the talk of death and extremism can indicate one's political stance.
        When looking through some of the comments, I noticed one that would say:
        "Kill all black people". Phrases like these may indicate prejudice and 
        racisist beliefs which can historically be associated to the right wing of
        the political spectrum
    
    45: index 45 maps to feature 15 which is liwc_adverb
        This may suggest that different political sides have varying expressiveness.
        adverbs are often used to describe the statement or situation more thoroughly.
    
    86: index 86 maps to feature 56 which is liwc_negate
        Perhaps some political stances like to use more negations than positive words.
        For example, one side may be more likely to defend or deflect accusations. (Think Trump) 

    111: index 111 maps to feature 81 which is liwc_time
        The talk of time may indicate the commenter's age and timeschedule. For example, university 
        students have a very intense work schedule and may comment on having no time more than highschool 
        students. While an older generation may have more time due to retirement. Age is generally correlated
        to political stance.

b) The p-values for 50 and 5 k features were the same. I suspect that this is because of the nature
    of p-values in statistics. The p-value are the probabilities of obtaining results of at least as
    extreme as the actual results. This means that as the number of features used does not contibute 
    significantly to classification. Classification results are already low due to teh dataset provided.
    The data can be vague such as updates on life which leads to a low accuracy of predictions.

c) The top 5 features are death, adverb, negate, time, and risk
    the first 4 were explained in part a. Risk may help identify political stance because of how
    must risk they may take with financial stability or taking a leap of faith in other instances.
    A younger generation is more likely to be left winged and they tend to be more open-minded about
    new ideas and concepts.
